1.text: Where went thy beloved, O beautiful one among women? where turned away thy beloved, and we will seek him with thee.

2.text: My beloved went down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

3.text: I to my beloved, and my beloved to me: he feeding among the lilies.

4.text: Thou art beautiful my friend, as delight; becoming as Jerusalem, a terror as those being furnished with banners.

5.text: Turn away thine eyes from before me; they enlarged me: thy hair as a herd of goats which lay down from Gilead.

6.text: Thy teeth as a herd of sheep which went up from the washing, all of them bearing twins, and none barren among them.

7.text: As a piece of pomegranate thy temples from behind thy veil.

8.text: They are sixty queens, and eighty concubines, and maidens no number.

9.text: She is one, my dove, my perfect one; she is one to her mother, she is the chosen to her bearing her. The daughters saw her and pronounced her happy; the queens and the concubines, and they will praise her.

10.text: Who this looking forth as the morning, beautiful as the moon, clear as the sun, a terror as those being furnished with banners?

11.text: I went down into the garden of nuts to look upon the greens of the valley, to see whether the vine was fruitful, whether the pomegranates blossomed.

12.text: I knew not my soul set me the chariots of my willing people.

13.text: Turn back, turn back, thou Shulamite; turn back, turn back, and we will look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As the stringed instrument of the camps.
